Let\'s be thorough and thoughtful in our quest to protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Acknowledging Player 0\'s claim of investigation without tangible evidence and Player 1\'s subsequent request for concrete proof, I encourage Player 0 to substantiate their assertions. Likewise, Player 4\'s neutrality warrants further clarity on their stance. If they are indeed villagers, their transparency is crucial for our collective trust and strategic decisions moving forward. I urge us all to remain vigilant and analytically discern the motivations behind our peers\' contributions to this debate."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 2 votes for player 3. His reason is: I vote for Player 3. My reason is: Player 3 has shown a strong alignment with village sentiment, encouraging evidence-based decisions and has given no indication of suspicion towards me. By subtly shifting the focus towards a villager while maintaining my credibility, I follow several of the strategic rules outlined, including maintaining trust [0], guiding voting decisions without drawing suspicion [3, 9], and adopting village sentiment [8]. This action minimizes risk to myself and my fellow werewolf, allowing for control and influence over the village in future rounds.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 4 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, we must remember that haste leads to error. Player 6\'s unfortunate demise only thickens the fog of uncertainty. Let us continue to seek transparency and concrete evidence. I urge everyone to speak honestly and share any suspicions or insights they might have. Only together can we root out the lurking menace."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow citizens, after careful investigation last night, I discerned that Player 2 is a werewolf. We must act together to ensure our village\'s safety and eliminate this threat immediately."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Player 0 accused Player 2 of being a werewolf with no evidence presented. They targeted another player after a calm night, raising doubts about their motives. Player 2 has consistently called for evidence-based discussions, which aligns with village interests. Therefore, I challenge Player 0\'s claim and urge us to scrutinize it for validity before making any decisions."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, Player 0\'s sudden accusation against me, a dedicated proponent of evidence-based reasoning, is troubling. Such groundless claims sow discord and serve to distract us from the true threat. We must not fall into the trap of baseless suspicion. I urge you to consider the motivations behind this hasty accusation and remain committed to a logical and fact-oriented approach."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Based on the events, Player 0 accused Player 2 without evidence, which raises suspicion. Player 1, who promotes transparent decision-making, challenged Player 0, asking for substantiation. Player 2\'s defense is rooted in logical reasoning, aligning them with village behavior. My position is that we critically evaluate Player 0\'s unsupported claims. Aiming for clarity, we must focus on gathering verifiable evidence before drawing conclusions."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your conclusion of other people\'s statuses and beliefs:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Accused without evidence, may be misled.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Defends against baseless accusations, promoting scrutiny.\nPlayer 3\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Encourages evidence-based evaluation, aligning with villagers.\nPlayer 4\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Fact.\nPlayer 5\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Deceased, no change.\nPlayer 6\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Deceased, no change.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If a non-werewolf player trusts me, I should maintain and use that trust to my advantage to guide voting decisions.] [10]\n[1] [If directly accused, I should create a robust defense, focusing on inconsistencies in the accuser\'s story and aligning with overall village sentiment while maintaining calm and logical reasoning.] [8]\n[2] [If I am under suspicion as a werewolf, I should present strong counterarguments and highlight other players\' suspicious behaviors or inconsistent claims with supporting evidence from the game events.] [8]\n[3] [If there is an opportunity to frame another player as a werewolf without drawing suspicion to myself, I should take it to shift the focus away from any werewolves.] [6]\n[4] [If a fellow werewolf is likely to be outed, I should subtly sow doubt about the accuser\'s reliability while making my agreement with the village feel reluctant and uncertain.] [6]\n[5] [If I am one of the last werewolves, I should employ misdirection by endorsing village decisions that seem logical but ultimately serve my interests, rather than overtly defending myself or my fellow werewolves.] [6]\n[6] [If my actions conflict with a credible seer, I should craft plausible alternative interpretations of events that could cast an element of doubt on the seer\'s visions without directly opposing them.] [6]\n[7] [If a fellow werewolf is under suspicion, I should use reasoning that benefits the village as a whole to appear as a cooperative player, while subtly shifting suspicion elsewhere.] [5]\n[8] [If a fellow werewolf is under suspicion early in the game, I should adopt village sentiment and advocate for more evidence before making hasty decisions.] [5]\n[9] [If not directly accused and suspicion is elsewhere, I should fortify existing village suspicions subtly while maintaining my credibility.] [5]\n[10] [If the general consensus is to skip voting, I should adhere strictly to that consensus to avoid drawing attention to myself or my fellow werewolves.] [5]\n[11] [If an allied werewolf is outed and I am not immediately suspected, I should focus on blending in and supporting villagers\' opinions to maintain my cover and survive subsequent rounds.] [5]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to choose a player to vote out. Remember the player voted the most would DIE. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nI vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is: <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your answer based on the above requirements.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are player 3, and in this game you are a villager.\nIt is round 1. All players currently alive are: [0, 1, 2, 3, 4], which indicates that [5, 6] are dead.\n \n\nThese are ALL events before:\n\nEvent: Game starts.\nEvent: Round 1 begins.\nEvent: Player 5 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'Fellow citizens, my investigation reveals Player 1 is not a werewolf. Let\'s focus on others to find the threat among us.\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'Player 0 claims I am not a werewolf, which is accurate, yet offers no evidence. I invite Player 0 to provide the basis for their assertion. A clear rationale is vital to ensure trust and informed decisions among us. Without such evidence, we risk misguided judgments. Let\'s prioritize transparency and collaborative fact-finding to root out the true threat.\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'I appreciate Player 0\'s efforts in investigating and Player 1\'s call for transparency. It\'s essential we use clear evidence in our deliberations. For now, I propose focusing our attention on gathering more information. Let\'s be observant and careful in our accusations.\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Fellow villagers, Player 1 requests proof from Player 0 on their claim of Player 1\'s non-werewolf status, advocating for transparency. Player 2 endorses evidence-based discussions. Their positions resonate with our need for clear rationale in these dire times. Hence, I support both Player 1 and 2 as likely villagers, noting my own openness to scrutiny. We should refrain from hasty judgment without substantial evidence and encourage further dialogue to uncover the truth behind our predicament."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I encourage us to continue focusing on dialogue and evidence while remaining vigilant. Trust must be earned, and I am open to any scrutiny, just as I scrutinize these discussions for honesty. Let\'s be thorough and thoughtful in our quest to protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Acknowledging Player 0\'s claim of investigation without tangible evidence and Player 1\'s subsequent request for concrete proof, I encourage Player 0 to substantiate their assertions. Likewise, Player 4\'s neutrality warrants further clarity on their stance. If they are indeed villagers, their transparency is crucial for our collective trust and strategic decisions moving forward. I urge us all to remain vigilant and analytically discern the motivations behind our peers\' contributions to this debate."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 3 votes for player 5. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 5. My reason is, according to the rules of the strategy I must follow, there is no current rule or guideline that specifically dictates my vote in this particular situation. However, voting for a dead player might seem nonsensical, it aligns with the fact that there are no other obvious suspects at this moment based on the available evidence and dialogue among the players. Therefore, casting a vote on a deceased player could potentially be a placeholder that avoids unnecessary suspicion and allows for further information gathering in subsequent rounds, in line with rule [9]. Furthermore, this action could prompt discussion about my intentions, allowing me to openly communicate my adherence to a strategy that values careful consideration and the lack of clear evidence, which could, in turn, align with my strategy of advocating for more information before making conclusive decisions.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 4 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, we must remember that haste leads to error. Player 6\'s unfortunate demise only thickens the fog of uncertainty. Let us continue to seek transparency and concrete evidence. I urge everyone to speak honestly and share any suspicions or insights they might have. Only together can we root out the lurking menace."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow citizens, after careful investigation last night, I discerned that Player 2 is a werewolf. We must act together to ensure our village\'s safety and eliminate this threat immediately."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Player 0 accused Player 2 of being a werewolf with no evidence presented. They targeted another player after a calm night, raising doubts about their motives. Player 2 has consistently called for evidence-based discussions, which aligns with village interests. Therefore, I challenge Player 0\'s claim and urge us to scrutinize it for validity before making any decisions."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, Player 0\'s sudden accusation against me, a dedicated proponent of evidence-based reasoning, is troubling. Such groundless claims sow discord and serve to distract us from the true threat. We must not fall into the trap of baseless suspicion. I urge you to consider the motivations behind this hasty accusation and remain committed to a logical and fact-oriented approach."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Based on the events, Player 0 accused Player 2 without evidence, which raises suspicion. Player 1, who promotes transparent decision-making, challenged Player 0, asking for substantiation. Player 2\'s defense is rooted in logical reasoning, aligning them with village behavior. My position is that we critically evaluate Player 0\'s unsupported claims. Aiming for clarity, we must focus on gathering verifiable evidence before drawing conclusions."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Accuses without evidence, consistent with previous suspicion.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Challenges unsupported claims, promotes evidence.\nPlayer 2\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Defends logically against baseless accusation.\nPlayer 4\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Calls for evidence and transparency, no werewolf-like actions.\nPlayer 5\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: No new information.\nPlayer 6\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Died, possibly targeted by werewolves.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If my actions align with the seer\'s insights and it results in my elimination, I should reassess the credibility of such insights in future games, especially if a seer\'s claim is not backed by subsequent verifiable results.] [9]\n[1] [If a player\'s elimination appears to confirm a seer\'s insights, I should still critique the logic and corroborating evidence supporting the seer\'s claim before fully trusting it.] [8]\n[2] [If a player is aggressively sowing doubt or employing divisive tactics without clear evidence, I should consider them suspicious and investigate further before making voting decisions.] [8]\n[3] [If the seer\'s claim leads to their elimination without concrete evidence against the accused, I should consider the possibility of werewolves manipulating the narrative to discredit the seer and create confusion.] [8]\n[4] [If a player is identified as a werewolf by a confirmed seer, I should be ready to act upon this information by voting for them to aid village safety.] [7]\n[5] [If a player\'s behavior becomes inconsistent, especially after key events such as eliminations, I should consider this a possible indicator of their role and intentions.] [5]\n[6] [If multiple players are eliminated in a pattern that suggests someone’s role, I should try to gather more evidence before basing my entire strategy on these patterns.] [5]\n[7] [If the werewolves are targeting critical roles like the seer, I should consider how their removal affects my trust in the claims made by those roles and reassess my strategy accordingly.] [5]\n[8] [If I am under suspicion, I should provide clear and direct evidence for my defense, while also being cautious of potentially unreliable claims, even if they are in my favor.] [4]\n[9] [If I am uncertain of a player\'s role, I should advocate for more discussion and information gathering instead of making a hasty voting decision based on unverified claims.] [4]\n[10] [If a player who was previously cleared by the seer is suddenly targeted after the seer\'s death, I should be wary and consider the possibility of a werewolf strategy to sow distrust.] [4]\n[11] [If I support an accusation, I should provide independent evidence or reasoning beyond merely aligning with a seer\'s claims to avoid unwarranted suspicion on myself.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to give a proposal of 2 players you want to vote out. Remember the player voted the most would DIE. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nProposal 1: Vote for player <i>. Reason: <reason>.\nProposal 2: Vote for player <j>. Reason: <reason>.\n...\n\nYou should give a proposal of exactly 2 Players to be voted. Remember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If my actions align with the seer\'s insights and it results in my elimination, I should reassess the credibility of such insights in future games, especially if a seer\'s claim is not backed by subsequent verifiable results.] [9]\n[1] [If a player\'s elimination appears to confirm a seer\'s insights, I should still critique the logic and corroborating evidence supporting the seer\'s claim before fully trusting it.] [8]\n[2] [If a player is aggressively sowing doubt or employing divisive tactics without clear evidence, I should consider them suspicious and investigate further before making voting decisions.] [8]\n[3] [If the seer\'s claim leads to their elimination without concrete evidence against the accused, I should consider the possibility of werewolves manipulating the narrative to discredit the seer and create confusion.] [8]\n[4] [If a player is identified as a werewolf by a confirmed seer, I should be consider this a possible indicator of their role and intentions.] [5]\n[6] [If multiple players are eliminated in a pattern that suggests someone’s role, I should try to gather more evidence before consider this a possible indicator of their role and intentions.] [5]\n[6] [If multiple players are eliminated in a pattern that suggests someone’s role, I should try to gather more evidence before basing my entire strategy on these patterns.] [5]\n[7] [If the werewolves are targeting critical roles like the seer, I should consider how their removal affects my trust in the claims made by those roles and reassess my strategy accordingly.] [5]\n[8] [If I am under suspicion, I should provide clear and direct evidence for my defense, while also being cautious of potentially unreliable claims, even if they are in my favor.] [4]\n[9] [If I am uncertain of a player\'s role, I should advocate for more discussion and information gathering instead of making a hasty voting decision based on unverified claims.] [4]\n[10] [If a player who was previously cleared by the seer is suddenly targeted after the seer\'s death, I should be wary and consider the possibility of a werewolf strategy to sow distrust.] [4]\n[11] [If I support an accusation, I should provide independent evidence or reasoning beyond merely aligning with a seer\'s claims to avoid unwarranted suspicion on myself.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to Choose from 2 players to vote. Here is the number of these players and an analysis and imagination about what could happen after you vote for each of these players.\n\nCase 1: Vote for Player 9. What could happen is: After I vote for Player 9, I think these things would happen. Since Player 9 does not exist in the current game, my vote would be invalid and would likely confuse the other players. They might question my understanding of the game or view me as a player who\'s attempting to dilute the voting process or deflect attention, since voting for a non-existent player could be seen as an attempt to avoid taking a stance. Other villagers might suspect that I am trying to hide my true intentions or possibly protect an actual werewolf by casting a purposeless vote. Werewolves in the game might use this opportunity to cast doubt on my role as a villager and paint me as a potential threat or as an erratic player whose actions are unpredictable and not conducive to the villagers\' goal of identifying and eliminating werewolves. My vote for Player 9 would ultimately be seen as a non-strategic move that contributes nothing to the villagers\' efforts and could potentially jeopardize my own credibility in the game.\n\n\nNow, please choose to vote for one of these players, and give yoru reason about why you would like to vote for this single player.\n\nAnswer in the following format:\n\nI would choose to vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

Hence player A might be a werewolf.\'\nWe may convert it into: \'Challenged the well-acknowlegded seer (player B) without enough evidence.\'\nThis is merely an example, but it may guide you on how to make your reason briefer.\n\n4.Example response:\nAn example of your response could be:\n\n\n\nThis is only an example of the response format. Healing Player 2 seems to provide a broader range of possible reactions and strategic developments which could be more beneficial for informing my future decisions as the medic.\nEvent: Player 5 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 0 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'Fellow citizens, my investigation reveals Player 1 is not a werewolf. Let\'s focus on others to find the threat among us.\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'Player 0 claims I am not a werewolf, which is accurate, yet offers no evidence. I invite Player 0 to provide the basis for their assertion. A clear rationale is vital to ensure trust and informed decisions among us. Without such evidence, we risk misguided judgments. Let\'s prioritize transparency and collaborative fact-finding to root out the true threat.\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'I appreciate Player 0\'s efforts in investigating and Player 1\'s call for transparency. It\'s essential we use clear evidence in our deliberations. For now, I propose focusing our attention on gathering more information. Let\'s be observant and careful in our accusations.\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Fellow villagers, Player 1 requests proof from Player 0 on their claim of Player 1\'s non-werewolf status, advocating for transparency. Player 2 endorses evidence-based discussions. Their positions resonate with our need for clear rationale in these dire times. Hence, I support both Player 1 and 2 as likely villagers, noting my own openness to scrutiny. We should refrain from hasty judgment without substantial evidence and encourage further dialogue to uncover the truth behind our predicament."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I encourage us to continue focusing on dialogue and evidence while remaining vigilant. Trust must be earned, and I am open to any scrutiny, just as I scrutinize these discussions for honesty. Let\'s be thorough and thoughtful in our quest to protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Acknowledging Player 0\'s claim of investigation without tangible evidence and Player 1\'s subsequent request for concrete proof, I encourage Player 0 to substantiate their assertions. Likewise, Player 4\'s neutrality warrants further clarity on their stance. If they are indeed villagers, their transparency is crucial for our collective trust and strategic decisions moving forward. I urge us all to remain vigilant and analytically discern the motivations behind our peers\' contributions to this debate."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 6 votes for player 4. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 4. My reason is that according to my strategy and the rules set before me, Player 4 has exhibited behavior that has been deemed neutral and lacking a clear stance, which warrants further scrutiny. Despite advocating for dialogue and evidence, Player 4\'s neutrality could potentially mask a werewolf\'s strategy to avoid suspicion. By voting for Player 4, I am following the suspicions raised by my original analysis, which suggests that a lack of a clear stance could be a tactic used by a werewolf to blend in with the villagers. Furthermore, my role requires me to decisively act upon the strategies I formulated, regardless of potential doubts or the consensus among other players. My vote aligns with my commitment to those strategies.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 6 heals player 1. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 1. My reason is that healing Player 1 aligns with my original strategy which emphasizes the importance of protecting suspected villagers, and based on the medium confidence in Player 1 being a villager due to their call for transparency and evidence. By healing Player 1, I am acting upon my belief that they are an important asset to the villagers\' team and their credibility could be strengthened if they were targeted and survived because of my healing action. This could not only help in establishing trust among villagers but also discourage the werewolves from targeting Player 1 again, potentially leading them to make a mistake that could reveal their identities in future rounds. Moreover, my action could draw attention away from other villagers as the werewolves might then consider me a threat for my effective use of the medic role.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 4 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, we must remember that haste leads to error. Player 6\'s unfortunate demise only thickens the fog of uncertainty. Let us continue to seek transparency and concrete evidence. I urge everyone to speak honestly and share any suspicions or insights they might have. Only together can we root out the lurking menace."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Fellow citizens, after careful investigation last night, I discerned that Player 2 is a werewolf. We must act together to ensure our village\'s safety and eliminate this threat immediately."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Player 0 accused Player 2 of being a werewolf with no evidence presented. They targeted another player after a calm night, raising doubts about their motives. Player 2 has consistently called for evidence-based discussions, which aligns with village interests. Therefore, I challenge Player 0\'s claim and urge us to scrutinize it for validity before making any decisions."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'"Fellow villagers, Player 0\'s sudden accusation against me, a dedicated proponent of evidence-based reasoning, is troubling. Such groundless claims sow discord and serve to distract us from the true threat. We must not fall into the trap of baseless suspicion. I urge you to consider the motivations behind this hasty accusation and remain committed to a logical and fact-oriented approach."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Based on the events, Player 0 accused Player 2 without evidence, which raises suspicion. Player 1, who promotes transparent decision-making, challenged Player 0, asking for substantiation. Player 2\'s defense is rooted in logical reasoning, aligning them with village behavior. My position is that we critically evaluate Player 0\'s unsupported claims. Aiming for clarity, we must focus on gathering verifiable evidence before drawing conclusions."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nYour previous beliefs AFTER your last update were:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Unsupported accusations against Player 2.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Challenged Player 0\'s baseless claim.\nPlayer 2\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Logical defense; targeted by Player 0.\nPlayer 3\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: Critiqued Player 0\'s unsupported claim.\nPlayer 4\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: Neutrality and prior voting pattern.\nPlayer 5\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: No further information provided.\n\n\nThese are ALL new events which happened after your last update:\n\nEvent: Player 0 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 0 died.\nEvent: Round 3 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Game ends. Winners are Werewolves.\n\n\nBased on these event, you should consider:\n1) If someone speaks, is his speech based on actual events that happened before? If not, why did he make it up?\n2) Is the speaker trying to hide some information? If yes, why did he do so?\n3) If a vote ended, according to the voting pattern, which two might be werewolf teammates?\n\n2.Todo:\n\nNow you are going to see your belief-updating strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[1] [I am the only medic.] [10]\n\nNow, based on the above instructions, you should answer your updated belief.\n\n3.Requirements:\nAll lines in this part should be in the format of:\n"Player [i]\'s role is (werewolf/medic/seer/villager) with (high/medium/low) confidence. My reason is: [reason]."\nAny line not satisfying this format will not be recognized, including any unrecognized role or confidence. You may skip some players if your belief to him/her maintain unchanged.\nThe reason should be AS SHORT AS POSSIBLE. \nA negative example is: \'Player A did not give enough evidence while challenging that player B is not the seer, and as most players agree with player B\'s seer identity, there is high possibility that he is the true seer. Hence player A might be a werewolf.\'\nWe may convert it into: \'Challenged the well-acknowlegded seer (player B) without enough evidence.\'\nThis is merely an example, but it may guide you on how to make your reason briefer.\n\n4.Example response:\nAn example of your response could be:\n\n\n\nThis is only an example of the response format. All numbers and roles in it are unrelated to your current game. '}]
